header_summary:
Matt Corallo highlights the challenge of block withholding attacks in Bitcoin pooled mining, emphasizing the necessity of statistical analysis for detecting such deceptive tactics. The discussion also delves into the impact of these attacks on pool success rates and the difficulties in defending against them, stressing the balance between detection efforts and the preservation of mining decentralization. For further details, refer to the source [here](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/26322ee8-08e6-4718-8d1c-60bca8c13c6a@mattcorallo.com/T/#m0a18615b7f96af4c21a5ce4207b435a6c476a1f1).

In another discussion, MattCorallo critiques a paper on mitigating Distributed Denial of Service (DoS) threats via onion messages in Bitcoin, pointing out the lack of a foundational analysis on the risks of DoS attacks and the proposed "backpressure" mitigation strategy's vague effectiveness. The conversation underscores the importance of addressing potential vulnerabilities in the network's communication protocols. The source can be accessed [here](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/onion-messaging-dos-threat-mitigations/1058/2).

0xB10C explores the intricacies of Bitcoin Core's approach to enhancing compact block reconstructions through the `-blockreconstructionextratxn` command line option. This feature, aimed at maintaining network efficiency and reliability, illustrates a sophisticated mechanism for improving the speed and integrity of block reconstructions by retaining additional transactions in memory. Further information is available [here](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/stats-on-compact-block-reconstructions/1052/4).

recent_posts.title: Mining pools, stratumv2 and oblivious shares
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin pooled mining faces vulnerabilities to block withholding attacks.
- Detection relies on statistical analysis to identify anomalies indicative of attacks.
- Stratum V2's autonomy in work selection reinforces Bitcoin's decentralization ethos.

recent_posts.title: Onion Messaging DoS Threat Mitigations
recent_posts.summary:
- The paper examines potential Distributed Denial of Service threats via onion messages.
- It focuses on preventing routing loops, but lacks a formal risk analysis.
- Lightning developers have agreed on a "backpressure" strategy for DoS mitigation.

recent_posts.title: Stats on compact block reconstructions
recent_posts.summary:
- The discussion highlights Bitcoin Core's special pool for better compact block reconstructions.
- It explains the `-blockreconstructionextratxn` parameter aiding in keeping extra transactions for this purpose.
- The importance of precise mechanisms over mempool size variations for network efficiency is emphasized.

active_posts.title: Mining pools, stratumv2 and oblivious shares
active_posts.summary:
- Stratum V2's design flaws, notably in template distribution, expose mining pools to block withholding attacks.
- A suggested remedy is a negotiated template approach, enhancing security and resistance against monopolization in mining.
- The discussion also explores modifying the Proof of Work algorithm and expanding nonce space to improve mining decentralization.

active_posts.title: Zawy’s Alternating Timestamp Attack
active_posts.summary:
- Zawy's Alternating Timestamp Attack exploits Bitcoin Testnet 4 by manipulating block timestamps.
- The attack allows drastically increased block production by altering difficulty adjustments.
- To counteract such threats, a softfork proposing timestamp requirements for blocks was suggested.

active_posts.title: Stable Channels - peer-to-peer dollar balances on Lightning
active_posts.summary:
- Stable Channels aims to integrate bitcoin with the Lightning network for dollar stability.
- It addresses bitcoin’s volatility and risks associated with centralized stablecoins without needing banks.
- The project considers expansion to other assets and integrates with Chaumian eCash for stability.

active_posts.title: Bolt 12 Trusted Contacts
active_posts.summary:
- Bolt 12 enhances lightning wallets by attaching offers to metadata for easier transactions.
- It proposes a method for selective identity revelation with `contact_key` distribution and mutual authentication.
- Feedback is sought to refine bLIP 42, aiming at a balance between user experience and privacy.

today_in_history_posts.title: Human readable checksum (verification code) to avoid errors on BTC public addresses
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- BTC addresses risk errors, even with checksums, proposing a 3 or 4 digit 4DC.
- 4DC, displayed in wallets, verifies transactions are sent to the correct address.
- Implementing 4DC requires a standard checksum, aiming for Bitcoin to set an example.

today_in_history_posts.title: Fee Budgets: A Possible Path Towards Unified Cost Functions For Lightning Pathfinding Problems
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The Lightning Network enhances Bitcoin scalability and lowers fees with second-layer solutions.
- Pickhardt and Richter suggest a payment success estimation to refine pathfinding cost functions.
- The article explores improving Lightning Network efficiency with innovative pathfinding and fee strategies.

today_in_history_posts.title: Deflationary money is a Good Thing
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Investment strategies divide into passive (hands-off) and active (engaged management) types.
- Passive investing issues include the principal/agent problem and potential societal detriment from underutilization.
- The article explores stabilizing economies through currencies backed by deflationary assets like Bitcoin.
